cas2xb3_finalprototype

Class LuggageGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • cas2xb3_finalprototype.LuggageGraph

  • public class LuggageGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    The purpose of this class is to create a luggage graph that connects airports with airlines in the form of a multidimensional array. This is to coordinate the positions of the airport and airlines by their own IDs.
    Author:
    Group 11 - Software Engineering 2XB3.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LuggageGraph(int airlineVerticeNumber, int airportVerticeNumber)
      Initializes empty edge-weighted graph for the luggage with V vertices and 0 edges

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEdge(Edge e)
      This will add an edge between an airline and an airport, and will fill each of their respective adjacency list.
      int E()
      Returns number of Edges
      int getAirlineVerticeNumber()
      Returns the number of airline vertices.
      int getAirportVerticeNumber()
      Returns number of airport vertices
      double ratio(int i)
      This returns the ratio of a particular airport vertex by determining the average luggage lost per airline at a specific airport.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LuggageGraph

        public LuggageGraph(int airlineVerticeNumber,
                    int airportVerticeNumber)
        Initializes empty edge-weighted graph for the luggage with V vertices and 0 edges
        Parameters:
        airlineVerticeNumber - This is the number of airline vertices that are present in the graph.
        airportVerticeNumber - This is the number of airport vertices that are present in the graph.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of vertices is negative.

    • Method Detail

      • getAirportVerticeNumber

        public int getAirportVerticeNumber()
        Returns number of airport vertices
        Returns:
        number of airport vertices

      • getAirlineVerticeNumber

        public int getAirlineVerticeNumber()
        Returns the number of airline vertices.
        Returns:
        This returns the number of total airlines.

      • E

        public int E()
        Returns number of Edges
        Returns:
        number of edges

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge(Edge e)
        This will add an edge between an airline and an airport, and will fill each of their respective adjacency list.
        Parameters:
        e - This is the edge that is inputted, which contains airline and airport vertices with their own ID. That ID indicates the index it will be placed in the adjacency lists (in a multidimensional array format).

      • ratio

        public double ratio(int i)
        This returns the ratio of a particular airport vertex by determining the average luggage lost per airline at a specific airport. This takes into consideration the airlines that are associated with an airport only.
        Parameters:
        i - The airport vertex's index.
        Returns:
        The ratio of luggage lost/airline at an airport.
